meanings.definition: A fossilized marine animal of the Paleozoic era, typically found in the form of branching or leaf-like structures.
meanings.sent1: The scientist discovered a graptolite fossil while exploring the ancient seabed.
meanings.sent2: Collectors often search for graptolite specimens to add to their fossil collections.
meanings.sent3: The graptolite fossil winked at the geologist, making her chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The graptolite fossil stood out in the rock like a delicate piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details of the graptolite fossil amazed the young paleontologist.

meanings.definition: A graptolite is an extinct group of colonial animals that lived in the oceans during the Paleozoic era.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a fascinating graptolite exhibit showcasing the ancient marine creatures.
meanings.sent2: Researchers study the remains of graptolites to learn more about prehistoric ocean life.
meanings.sent3: The graptolite colony threw a party in the ocean, inviting all the sea creatures.
meanings.sent4: The graptolite colony functioned like a bustling underwater city in its prime.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model of a graptolite to teach the students about ancient marine ecosystems.
